newsitem.title: INDIA: CRICKET-PACE PAIR PUT SOUTH AFRICA IN COMMAND.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-PACE PAIR PUT SOUTH AFRICA IN COMMAND.

text.p: Lance Klusener and Alan
Donald bowled South Africa into a commanding position on the
second day of a three-day match against India's Ranji Trophy
champions Karnataka on Monday.
The pace pair shot out Karnataka for 115 -- 128 ahead on
first innings. The South African batsmen drove home the
advantage by going for quick runs and left the hosts facing a
target of 362.
The Karnataka batsmen were sitting ducks on a pitch where
the occasional ball bounced awkwardly and stopped.
Their last six wickets tumbled for the addition of 31 runs
in only 65 minutes.
Klusener pressed his claims for test selection with
impressive figures of five for 38. Donald finished with four for
After the early dismissal of opener Gary Kirsten, the South
African second innings was propped up by a brisk 55 run
partnership between Andrew Hudson and Daryll Cullinan.
Hudson scored 36 off 79 balls while Cullinan's 32 came off
84 balls.
A minor collapse saw South Africa slump to 90 for four but
Jonty Rhodes and skipper Hanse Cronje stopped the rot with a
54-run fifth-wicket partnership.
Left-arm spinner Ananth Katti was the most impressive of the
Karnataka bowlers, claiming four for 67.
